prompt: <description>**Instructions to construct the first part** Construct a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom. The cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 4 units long, 2 units wide, and 1 unit tall. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of approximately 0.5 units. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1125, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. The sketch should consist of the following faces and loops: **Face 1** Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1875, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1875, 0.0], End Point [0.0948, 0.0706] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0948, 0.0706], End Point [0.631, 0.0706] - Line 4: Start Point [0.631, 0.0706], End Point [0.5625, 0.0021] - Line 5: Start Point [0.5625, 0.0021], End Point [0.75, 0.0021] - Line 6: Start Point [0.75, 0.0021], End Point [0.75, 0.1896] - Line 7: Start Point [0.75, 0.1896], End Point [0.0, 0.1875] - Line 8: Start Point [0.0, 0.1875], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Face 2** Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.1875], End Point [0.75, 0.1896] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.1896], End Point [0.5432, 0.4654] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.5432, 0.4654], Mid Point [0.3494, 0.2656], End Point [0.1656, 0.4747] - Line 3: Start Point [0.1656, 0.4747], End Point [0.0, 0.1875] **Face 3** Loop 1: - Circle 1: Center [0.354, 0.455], Radius 0.1894 Loop 2: - Circle 1: Center [0.354, 0.455], Radius 0.0954 **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same coordinate system. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch** Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.1125 to create the prism. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.1125 and the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0. The first part of the assembly is now complete.</description>

Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate\\_system. Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal direction to a depth of 0.25 units, resulting in the final 3D model. Part 2: Creating a Rectangular Prism with a Central Circular Hole Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 * Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.125 Next, create the 2D sketch for this part on the XY plane defined by the coordinate system. * Sketch Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1: starting point (0.0, 0.0), ending point (0.25, 0.0) - Line 2: starting point (0.25, 0.0), ending point (0.25, 0.25) - Line 3: starting point (0.25, 0.25), ending point (0.0, 0.25) - Line 4: starting point (0.0, 0.25), ending point (0.0, 0.0) After the 2D sketch is created, scale it using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale with a value of 0.25. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate\\_system. Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal direction to a depth of 0.25 units, but this time use the "JoinFeatureOperation" operation to combine it with the previous part. The result is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a diagonal cut through it, creating a void space. Part 1 forms the base of the prism, while Part 2 creates the diagonal cut.</description>
